availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Located in Louisville, Kentucky. Originally designed by Hugh Roland. Greek Revival architecture. First hotel in Kentucky. Burned down in 1853 and rebuilt. Kean, Steele, & Judge were the proprietors from 1860 to 1865.

ab.bibl: Appleton's Illistrated Railway and Steam Naviagation Guide (New York: Appleton & Co., 1864), 278. George H. Yater, "Louisville Hotel" in The Encyclopedia of Louisville, John E. Kleber, ed. (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 2001), 554. KYR-0001-002-0023.
